description: Roof extension to rear roof slope incorporating a Juliet balcony; roof extension to rear outrigger roof slope; installation of two rooflights to front roof slope; and creation of Juliet balcony to first floor rear elevation
decision_conditions: The development to which this permission relates shall be begun not later than the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.

Reason: To comply with Section 91 of the Town & Country Planning Act 1990. | The development hereby approved shall be carried out in accordance with the following drawings: 03-2021/69SR/100 (Existing First Floor Plan), 03-2021/69SR/101 (Existing Roof Plan), 03-2021/69SR/102 (Existing Section AA), 03-2021/69SR/103 (Existing Section/Elevation BB), 03-2021/69SR/104 (Existing Rear Elevation), 03-2021/69SR/105 (Existing Street Elevation), 03-2021/69SR/300 Rev A (Proposed First Floor Plan), 03-2021/69SR/301 Rev A (Proposed Second Floor Plan), 03-2021/69SR/302 Rev A (Proposed Roof Plan), 03-2021/69SR/303 Rev A (Proposed Section AA), 03-2021/69SR/304 Rev A (Proposed Section BB), 03-2021/69SR/305 Rev A (Proposed Elevation/Section CC), 03-2021/69SR/306 Rev A (Rear Elevation), 03-2021/69SR/307 Rev A (Street Elevation) and 03-2021/69SR/400 (Location Plan).

Reason: For the avoidance of doubt, and in the interests of proper planning. | Notwithstanding the details shown on the plans, all external materials to be used in the development shall match the appearance of those of the existing building.

Reason: To ensure that the materials harmonise with the surroundings, in accordance with policies 1.1 & 1.2 of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policies 7.4 & 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policies D3 and D4 of the London Plan (2021) and the National Planning Policy Framework (2021). | The hereby approved two (2) rooflights to the front roof slope of the dwelling shall not project more than 150mm from the plane of the roof slope when measured perpendicularly and shall be retained as such for the lifetime of the development.

Reason: To ensure that the materials harmonise with the surroundings, and to safeguard the character and appearance of the area in accordance with policy D4 of the London Plan (2021) and policies 7B and 7.4 of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013).
